oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter written from Jeff Montgomery to Ruth Hopper
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Jeff Montgomery, USMC, wrote this letter to his future wife Ruth Hopper in Jackson. He discusses having had another holiday, a reference to Thanksgiving, and that he had qualified as a "marksman." His letter is written on Jewish Welfare Board stationery. He wrote, "it seems like I patronize most every religious body on the island but who would have thought that I would come to a Jewish plase but this is the most quiet place on the island just room for about six Marines."
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
